author: Staff Reporter
text:
As many as 110 inmates of the Vellore Central Prison for Men have undergone training in leather stitching and skiving to enable them get jobs soon after release. The training was conducted by the Central Footwear Training Institute, Chennai.

“The 110 prisoners were trained in four batches. The duration of the training was for one month. They were trained in leather stitching and skiving as there are several leather industries in Vellore, and this could fetch them jobs once they are released,” said C. Krishnakumar, superintendent (in-charge), Vellore Central Prison for Men.

Prisoners serving both short-term and long-term were selected for the training programme. “We also trained prisoners who are to be released in three to six months time,” he added.

On Tuesday, the prisoners received the training certificates and stipend of Rs. 1,875 each.

title: Footwear institute trains prison inmates
